meanings.definition: Of or relating to a priest or priestly class.
meanings.sent1: The hieratic robes worn by the priest were adorned with sacred symbols.
meanings.sent2: The hieratic duties of the priest included leading ceremonies and offering prayers.
meanings.sent3: The hieratic priest accidentally spilled incense during the ritual.
meanings.sent4: Her demeanor was so hieratic, it seemed as if she held divine authority.
meanings.sent5: The hieratic presence of the priest commanded respect from all who gathered.

meanings.definition: Written in a simplified cursive form used in ancient Egypt.
meanings.sent1: The hieratic script was easier to write than the formal hieroglyphs.
meanings.sent2: Students practiced copying hieratic texts to learn the ancient writing style.
meanings.sent3: The hieratic symbols flowed across the papyrus with graceful simplicity.
meanings.sent4: Her notes were a hieratic mess, resembling ancient Egyptian scrolls.
meanings.sent5: The hieratic inscriptions on the tomb walls told stories of the pharaohs.

meanings.definition: Highly formal or stylized in manner.
meanings.sent1: The hieratic dance performed at the royal court was precise and elegant.
meanings.sent2: His speech was so hieratic, it felt like listening to a ceremonial address.
meanings.sent3: The hieratic artwork in the museum displayed intricate patterns and designs.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was hieratic, with every word carefully chosen and placed.
meanings.sent5: The hieratic gestures of the conductor guided the orchestra with authority.
